intro: Tragacantha crassinervia, commonly known as the broad-veined tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, broad-veined leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by pods containing small, rounded seeds. Tragacantha crassinervia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
